濟.definition: to cross a river; to aid or relieve; to be of help

濟事.definition: (usually used in the negative) to be of help or use

濟公.definition: Jigong or Daoji (1130-1207), Southern Song Dynasty Buddhist monk

濟南.definition: see 濟南市|济南市[Ji3nan2 Shi4]

濟南市.definition: Jinan, sub-provincial city and capital of Shandong Province 山東省|山东省[Shan1dong1 Sheng3]

濟危扶困.definition: to help people in difficulty and bring relief to the needy (idiom)

濟寧.definition: see 濟寧市|济宁市[Ji3ning2 Shi4]

濟寧市.definition: Jining, prefecture-level city in Shandong Province 山東省|山东省[Shan1dong1 Sheng3]

濟州.definition: Jeju Island special autonomous province (Cheju Island), South Korea, a World Heritage site

濟州島.definition: Jeju Island special autonomous province, South Korea, a World Heritage site

濟州特別自治道.pinyin: Ji4 zhou1 te4 bie2 zi4 zhi4 dao4
濟州特別自治道.definition: Jeju island special autonomous province, South Korea, a World Heritage site

濟水.definition: Ji River, former river of north-eastern China which disappeared after the Yellow River flooded in 1852

濟源.definition: Jiyuan directly administered city in Henan

濟源市.definition: Jiyuan directly administered city in Henan

濟濟一堂.definition: to congregate in one hall (idiom); to gather under one roof
